body:
Wrapping yourself up in a lovely towel after a shower or bath can be a sweet pleasure indeed. Whether you favour a towel that's plush and luxurious, quick drying, durable or all of the above, quality is crucial to the experience – no one likes a thin, scanty towel! Our MEB towel programs all deliver on quality – and price and value – in spades.


Read on to unwrap all you need to know about towels, including helping customers choose from our excellent range, and learning about Heritage, Vue and Australian House & Garden, our towel MEBs championing the quality-towel cause.
title: Intro

body:
Before we get into the nitty-gritty of our MEBs and towel programs, there are a few things you need to know about towels in general, namely:


• sizes
• GSM
• fabrics, and
• weaves


This section will arm you with expert knowledge on the subject of towels, enabling you to better help your customers find exactly what they’re looking for.
title: Text Title

body: Most people are familiar with available towel (and related paraphernalia) sizes, but here’s a quick refresher. Standard bath towels measure roughly 69cm x 137cm, while those cocoon-yourself-in-luxury bath sheets are usually around 91cm x 167cm. Most towel ranges offer face washers, hand towels and bath mats, too.
title: Need to know: sizes

body: GSM – short for grams per sq metre – indicates the weight of a towel based on the density of its fibres. Unlike thread count in sheets, which may or may not be an indicator of quality, GSM is a relatively reliable indictor of the quality of a towel, as a higher GSM means a towel is thicker (and heavier), more absorbent and plush, and ultimately more expensive.

_items.text: Bear in mind, though, that not everyone prefers super-plush towels, so GSM isn’t the only thing to consider when helping a customer choose.

title: Is bigger thread count always better?

body: Most bath towels are made of cotton, but not all cotton is created equal! Cotton towels vary in their softness, absorbency and durability, depending on what type of cotton is used to make them (as well as how that cotton is woven – see the next section). Following are the cotton fabrics we love the most.
title: Text Title

_items.title: EGYPTIAN COTTON
_items.body: Egyptian cotton towels are known for their quality – this type of cotton is hand-picked so that less stress is placed on the fibres, resulting in a higher-quality and very durable product. They’re also highly absorbent and beautifully soft, making them an exquisite way to dry yourself after a shower or bath.

_items.title: AUSTRALIAN COTTON
_items.body: Fabric made from Australian cotton, such as that used in Australian House & Garden’s natural Australian cotton bath towels, is also of the highest quality. This cotton is sourced in Australia, and the manufacturing of Australian cotton towels also takes place in Australia.

Cotton is often combed prior to weaving to make the yarn stronger and softer. It’s a bit like washing and combing your hair – knots, loose fibres and impurities are removed, leaving a finer, stronger cotton, which makes for a better-quality towel.
_items.title: COMBED COTTON
TURKISH COTTON
_items.body: Sourced from the Aegean region, Turkish cotton increases in softness and absorbency with successive washes. It’s made of extra-long cotton fibres, which create extra-strong and durable fabric.

body: Along with the type of cotton used, the weave of a towel determines its properties. Weave is the most complex thing about towels, but there’s no need to get bogged down in the details. The main terms to learn, particularly in relation to our towel programs, are ‘twist’ and ‘double yarn’.
title: Text Title

body: When a towel is made, the yarn is twisted to give the fabric strength; this makes the towel more durable. Lower quality fabrics tend to be heavily twisted, as the yarn itself is not very strong. The downside of this is that the towel won’t be as soft. Many higher quality towels are made with a low twist (eg Vue’s combed cotton ribbed towel) or zero twist (Myer Essentials’ quick dry towel), meaning they are exceptionally plush (although also subject to fluff coming off the towel). A semi twist is also quite common, as it provides a balance between softness and durability.
title: Text Title

body: Double yarn, or two-ply, simply means a towel is woven using two strands of yarn instead of just one. This ultimately makes the towel stronger and more durable, as with our Heritage premium Egyptian towels.
title: Text Title

_graphic.caption: Detail of Myer Essentials’ Quick Dry Zero Twist Towel

body: Which three of the following statements apply to GSM?

_incorrect.final:
Almost, but not quite.


A higher GSM towel is thicker, heavier, more absorbent and plush, and better quality than a lower GSM towel.

_partlyCorrect.final:
Almost, but not quite.


A higher GSM towel is thicker, heavier, more absorbent and plush, and better quality than a lower GSM towel.

_feedback.correct:
You got it!


A higher GSM towel is thicker, heavier, more absorbent and plush, and better quality than a lower GSM towel.

_items.text: It's a reliable indicator of a towel's quality.
It only applies to double-yarn towels.
A higher GSM means a towel is thicker, and more absorbent and plush.
It relates to the weight of a towel.

title: MCQ Title

body: Now that you know the basics, let’s look at our three MEBs for towels, each one of which represents exceptional quality and offers affordable solutions for bathroom bliss.
title: Text Title

body: Heritage is all about simple sophistication that has a sense of romance and elegance. It’s classic, feminine and refined, transcending seasons and time – perfect for the customer looking for longevity in their purchases.
title: Text Title

body: A fashionable lifestyle range, Vue has a contemporary and minimalist aesthetic that covers both basic core items and seasonal trends. It’s at once practical and stylish, incorporating youthful contemporary design that’s often driven by colour and pattern, and offers affordable towels for everyday living.
title: Text Title

body: This relaxed lifestyle brand reflects the Australian aesthetic, providing a range that’s high end, yet unpretentious and laid-back in style. Natural materials are key, as is contemporary design that’s unique and bespoke. This is easygoing, everyday living at its best, creating inviting bathroom spaces.
title: Text Title

_graphic.caption: Australian House & Garden 680GSM Natural Australian Cotton Towels

body: Each of our MEBs offers different programs, or ranges, that cater to different customer needs, preferences and budgets. The following are some of these programs, each one representing exceptional quality at a very competitive price.
title: Text Title

_items.body: The perfect everyday towel for busy people, the 100% cotton quick dry towel is designed to be tumble dried (this keeps the towel looking and feeling light and fluffy). It has a super-soft zero-twist construction, which makes it extra absorbent. Available in six colours; excellent entry-level product.
_items.title: Myer Essentials 450GSM Quick Dry Towel
Vue 620GSM Combed Cotton Ribbed Towel
_items.body: Delightfully soft, luxurious and heavy, Vue’s combed cotton towel has a low-twist construction, resulting in a very durable product with less pilling. Its textured modern ribbing with pin-tuck header (the stitching detail at the top and bottom of the towel) make it a design favourite. Don't be deterred by its low price – these towels are of a high quality and are designed for both comfort and durability. Available in nine colours.

Made from 100% double-yarn Egyptian cotton, this towel uses a thicker thread than standard in its construction, creating a highly durable towel. While it’s not as fluffy as, say, the quick dry towel, it’s still delightfully plush and highly absorbent. A luxe experience; available in nine colours.
_items.title: Heritage 620GSM Premium Egyptian Towel
Australian House & Garden 680GSM Natural Australian Cotton Towel
_items.body: Like Heritage’s Egyptian towel, the premium, luxury-weight Australian cotton towel uses a thicker thread to produce a more durable, beautifully plush and absorbent product that boasts a high GSM and superior quality cotton. Accented with a dobby border – a decorative striped weave; available in six colours.

body:
Now that you’re equipped with detailed knowledge about all things towel related at Myer, it’ll be a cinch to help your customers select from our range. But here are a few conversation starters to help you on your way:




❝
displayTitle: How to help your customers choose
title: Text Title

body: ❞
title: Text Title

body:
Following are some tips to keep your towels in tip-top shape:


• Always follow the care instructions and wash towels regularly;
• Use a gentle wash cycle with warm water (unless the care label indicates otherwise);
• Attend to any stains as soon as they occur, using an oxygen-based stain remover;
• Avoid using bleach as it’s too harsh on natural-fibre fabrics;
• Tumble dry towels according to label instructions, especially if you want your towels to feel softer; and
• Make sure your towels are bone dry before storing them in your linen cupboard to avoid a mildewy smell.

_items.text: When removing towels from your washing machine, give them a shake to aid their absorbency.

title: Treat your sheets sweetly

body:
While towels can be lovely to wrap ourselves in and dry off after showering, they can also double as decorator items, providing double the chance to suggest add-on items and increase your sales metrics. Some ideas:


• Bath mats, hand towels and face washers are the obvious add-on items to suggest, especially if your customer is after a coordinated look;
• Colours can be used to suggest additional purchases, eg “That charcoal towel you’ve selected looks gorgeous next to this coral-coloured one.”
• Suggesting more towels for when this set is in the wash, or for visitors.
• Coordinating towels with bathroom accessories, such as soap dispensers, soap dishes, toothbrush holders, portable mirrors and toilet brush holders.
title: Text Title

body: Which three of the following statements are correct? Australian House & Garden 680GSM Natural Australian Cotton towels are:

_incorrect.final:
Nearly!


Australian House & Garden 680GSM Natural Australian Cotton towels are premium, luxury-weight towels with a decorative striped weave on the border. They're available in six colours.

_partlyCorrect.final:

Australian House & Garden 680GSM Natural Australian Cotton towels are premium, luxury-weight towels with a decorative striped weave on the border. They're available in six colours.

_feedback.correct:
Well done!


Australian House & Garden 680GSM Natural Australian Cotton towels are premium, luxury-weight towels with a decorative striped weave on the border. They're available in six colours.

_items.text: Accented with a decorative striped weave on the border.

title: MCQ Title

body: You’re now well equipped to sell our towel programs with confidence and help your customers get that warm, fuzzy feeling from being cocooned in the finest quality towels. See our entire range of towels, including from brand partners such as Sheridan, at the following link.
